messageBody:
Wow, so much traffic to come back to on this list.  I've been traveling in China for several months (showing off the kids to my in-laws), but unlike Michael was not checking (all of) my email.  It seems there are some great developments afoot.

I downloaded the Thoth archive from the files section, and am getting an error when I try to install the Thoth.ttf file on my Mac.  The font fails validation, and the error indicates that it is "Missing OpenType Data."  ThothUni.ttf on the other hand installs correctly.

Has anyone else had this problem?  I downloaded the file twice, and tried unzipping it with several different utilities.  I also tried installing from the Thoth.ttf file in this archive:
http://quikscript.sourceforge.net/quikscript-snapshot.tar.gz
which was linked in another message.  That one does not fail, but it also does not install correctly.

oliver

On Wed 2007.10.31, at 15:48, Paul Tremblay wrote:

I have released a new font, which you can find in the files section in
the fonts directory. The new font is called Thoth. It also has a
counterpart, ThothUni, the Unicode version.

The Unicode version is based on the popular Gentium font, so it contains
thousands of glyphs, and one can use just ThothUni to mix up Traditional
orthography and QS in the same document by using just one font.

I consider Thoth to still be in its testing stage, so I appreciate any
feedback. In the zip file you will find the two fonts and a number of
PDF documents that I created using this font. The font looks best with a
program that recognizes the kerning (special space between letters). I
found that only XeLaTeX and InDesign recognized kerning. For this
reason, I included the PDF produced with XeLaTeX so you can see what the
font looks like displayed properly.

Paul
